item.title: Science Overview
item.description: https://www.ixl.com/science/ https://phet.colorado.edu/en/simulations/browse https://mysteryscience.com/ https://www.howtosmile.org/ https://climatekids.nasa.gov/ https://kids.frontiersin.org/ https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0885200617302442 In the United States, Science, Technology, Engineering and Math (STEM) topics have been increasingly recognized as appropriate and relevant for children to explore in early childhood settings (California Department of Education, 2012, Greenfield et al., 2009, McClure et al., 2017, National Science Foundation, 2013). The study finds preschoolers to be “little engineers,” who use their serendipitous science exposure to develop reasoning skills and solve simple problems in the world around them.
